intro: Gonolobus tobagensis, commonly known as the Tobaño morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, violet to blue flowers. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and twining stems that climb or trail along the ground. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and as a decorative plant.
